MvM, Boris... any idea if this could be related to the work you guys did for workbench progress?

Yes, this is caused because we are spinning the event loop and thus cause an 
asyncExec to execute while the required classes for that asyncExec are being 
loaded, hence the ClassCircularityError.

This would not happen if we either (1) did not spin the event loop (depends on 
bug 95667 - Display#update does not work on Windows XP - being fixed) or (2) 
delayed the asyncExecs as outlined in bug 95658.
In that case I'll assign it to you!

Philippe can you describe you setup or attach a workspace.  we'd like to know
for sure that we've fixed this?

attaching your .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.ui.workbench\workbench.xml file
would also be helpful.

My setup is a full source dev workspace (all plugins imported as source projects). 
It is pretty big, so unless you are desperate for it... 
BTW, any restart issues the same trace during startup.

Created an attachment (id=21480)
patch to workbench

Cannot reproduce any longer with patch.
Also my setup is using multiple windows, on winxp (in case that would matter)

Thanks Philippe!

Did you have a chance to try N20050520-0010 with your workspace?
Yes, and so far so good.

Marking as fixed since we are no longer running the event loop from our 
BundleListener.
